Diagnosis
	1. Anaplastic thyroid carcinoma T4bN1M1
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Diagnostic core biopsy
	25 Jan 2024 Attempted debulking surgery - inoperable due to extensive local invasion

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb 2024 - 28 Feb 2024
	Emergency palliative radiotherapy 30Gy in 10 fractions to neck mass for symptom control

	Chemotherapy
	Paclitaxel/Carboplatin commenced 5 Mar 2024
Discontinued after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible for current trials due to poor performance status

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with increasing dysphagia and stridor

	Current issues
	Dysphagia requiring NG feeding
Stridor requiring oxygen support
Progressive neck mass
New pulmonary metastases

	Summary of consultation
	This 68-year-old gentleman has unfortunately shown rapid progression of anaplastic thyroid cancer despite attempted multimodal treatment. Initially presenting with a rapidly enlarging neck mass in December 2023, biopsy confirmed anaplastic thyroid carcinoma with TP53 mutation. Attempted surgical debulking was unsuccessful due to extensive local invasion. Despite emergency palliative radiotherapy and two cycles of chemotherapy, disease has continued to progress both locally and systemically.

Current performance status is ECOG 3-4, spending most time in bed. Requires continuous oxygen support at 4L/min via nasal cannula. Nutrition is maintained via NG tube due to complete dysphagia. CT scan on 15 April 2024 shows enlarging neck mass now measuring 12x8cm with progressive tracheal compression, and new bilateral pulmonary metastases.

Given rapid deterioration despite treatment and poor performance status, focus of care has shifted to symptom management. I have had detailed discussions with [redacted name] and family regarding prognosis and goals of care.

	Further investigations
	None planned

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 8mg BD
Oxycodone MR 40mg BD
Oxycodone IR 5mg PRN
Metoclopramide 10mg TDS

	Follow up
	Referral made to local palliative care team for ongoing support
Hospital palliative care team reviewing daily during admission

	Required GP actions
	Palliative care team will coordinate community support
DNACPR in place
Preferred place of care documented as hospice when appropriate

	Summary of information given to patient
	Full discussion held with patient and family regarding poor prognosis and transition to palliative care approach. Family aware of likely prognosis of weeks rather than months.
